title: West Ham vs Arsenal WSL : TV channel , live stream , team news & prediction
body_text:
West Ham vs Arsenal WSL: TV channel, live stream, team news & prediction
By Ali Rampling
After a manic and ultimately unsuccessful transfer deadline day, Arsenal's attention turns back to the WSL on Sunday when they travel to east London to face West Ham.
The Gunners ultimately failed to land a striker that Jonas Eidevall had been after throughout the January transfer window as they go about attempting to wrestle the WSL title back from Chelsea during the second half of the campaign.
Arsenal face a West Ham side on the hunt for their first WSL three points since December. The Hammers progressed in both the Continental and FA Cup last week, keeping a pair of clean sheets in the process.
Where to watch West Ham vs Arsenal WSL on TV/live stream
When is kick off? Sunday 5 February, 18:45 (GMT)
Where is the match being played? Chigwell Construction Stadium
TV channel/live stream? Sky Sports Football/Premier League/Main Event (UK), FA Player (International)
What time does coverage start in the UK? 18:30 (GMT)
Referee? Richie Watkins
West Ham team news
West Ham continue to be without Jess Zui, sidelined with an ACL injury. Paul Konchesky has an otherwise has a 'fully fit' squad to choose from on Sunday. Deadline day signings Amalie Thestrup and Shannon Cooke could be in contention to make their debuts.
Arsenal team news
Beth Mead and Vivianne Miedema remain long-term absentees for Arsenal as the pair continue their recoveries from respective ACL injuries.
Lia Walti has sat out Arsenal's last two due to a small injury. Jonas Eidevall admitted the midfielder was 'progressing', but that Sunday's fixture would be 'too early' for her to return.
West Ham vs Arsenal score prediction
West Ham have never taken so much as a point against Arsenal, losing all eight of their previous WSL encounters. The Gunners were 3-1 winners when the pair met in the reverse fixture, but the Hammers had taken the lead and were unfortunate to see a second goal disallowed.
Arsenal should have too much quality, even in the absence of the instrumental Walti, and will be expected to take three points again on Sunday.
